newsitem.title: THAILAND: Bank of Thailand sells up to $50 mln on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Thailand sells up to $50 mln on Wednesday.

text.p: Bank of Thailand assistant governor Siri Garnjarerndee said on Wednesday the bank had sold between $40 and $50 million to commercial banks today following its flotation of the baht.
"We sold about $40 to $50 million today which was very small and insignificant," Siri told Reuters.
"The foreign exchange and money markets were calmer than we previously expected. However the central bank is still closely monitoring the situation," he said.

Thailand on Wednesday stunned markets by abruptly changing its system of pegging the baht to a basket of currencies and saying it would allow the baht to float with the currency's value being determined by market forces.
The baht initially plunged to a record low of around 29.00 baht to the dollar on the news as people rushed to the safer dollar, dealers said.
The currency later stabilised and was trading around 27.50/28.50 in domestic markets late.
